name: Average Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Average cyclomatic complexity for all nested functions or methods.

name: Average Modified Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Average modified cyclomatic complexity for all nested functions or methods

name: Avg Strict Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Average strict cyclomatic complexity for all nested functions or methods

name: Avg Essential Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Average essential cyclomatic complexity for all nested functions or methods.

name: Avg Number of Lines
description: Average number of lines for all nested functions or methods.

name: Avg Number of Blank Lines
description: Average number of blank for all nested functions or methods.

name: Avg Number of Lines of Code
description: Average number of lines containing source code for all nested functions or methods.

name: Avg Number of Lines with Comments
description: Average number of lines containing comment for all nested functions or methods.

name: Base Classes
description: Number of immediate base classes

name: Coupling Between Objects
description: 'The Coupling Between Object Classes (CBO) measure for a class is a count of the number of other classes to which it is coupled. Class A is coupled to class B if class A uses a type
research: or member from class B. This metric is also referred to as Efferent Coupling (Ce). Any number of couplings to a given class counts as 1 towards the metric total'

name: Number of Children
description: Number of immediate subclasses. (i.e. the number of classes one level down the inheritance tree from this class).

name: Class Methods
description: Number of class methods

name: Class Variables
description: Number of class variables

name: Local Methods
description: Number of local (not inherited) methods.
research: Chidamber & Kemerer - Weighted Methods per Class (WMC)

name: Methods
description: 'Number of methods

name: Instance methods
description: Number of instance methods

name: Instance Variables
description: Number of instance variables - variables defined in a class that are only accessable through an object of that class

name: Local Default Visibility Methods
description: Number of local default visibility methods

name: Private Methods
description: Number of local (not inherited) private methods.

name: Protected Methods
description: Number of local protected methods.

name: Public Methods
description: Number of public methods. Only counts local (not inherited) methods.

name: Number of physical lines
description: Number of physical lines

name: Number of blank lines
description: Number of blank lines

name: Source Lines of Code
description: The number of lines that contain source code. Note that a line can contain source and a comment and thus count towards multiple metrics. For Classes this is the sum of the CountLineCode for the member functions of the class

name: Number of declarative Lines of Code
description: Number of lines containing declarative source code. Note that a line can be declarative and executable - int i =0; for instance.

name: Executable Lines of Code
description: Number of lines containing executable source code.

name: Lines with Comments
description: 'Number of lines containing comment. This can overlap with other code counting metrics. For instance int j = 1; // comment has a comment

name: Number of semicolons
description: Number of semicolons

name: Statements
description: Number of declarative plus executable statements.

name: Declarative Statements
description: Number of declarative statements

name: Max Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Maximum cyclomatic complexity of all nested functions or methods.

name: Max Modified Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Maximum modified cyclomatic complexity of all nested functions or methods.

name: Max Strict Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Maximum strict cyclomatic complexity of all nested functions or methods.

name: Max Essential Complexity
description: Maximum essential complexity of all nested functions or methods.

name: Depth of Inheritance Tree (DIT)
description: 'The depth of a class within the inheritance hierarchy is the maximum number of nodes from the class node to the root of the inheritance tree. The root node has a DIT of 0. The deeper within the hierarchy
categorie: the more methods the class can inherit
column7: Chidamber & Kemerer - Depth of Inheritance Tree (DIT)

name: Nesting
description: 'Maximum nesting level of control constructs (if

name: Percent Lack of Cohesion in Methods
description: '100% minus average cohesion for class data members. Calculates what percentage of class methods use a given class instance variable. To calculate
categorie: average percentages for all of that class’es instance variables and subtract from 100%. A lower percentage means higher cohesion between class data and methods.'
column6: Chidamber & Kemerer - Lack of Cohesion in Methods (LCOM/LOCM)

name: Percent Modified Lack of Cohesion in Methods
description: Same as PercentLackOfCohesion but does not penalize the use of accessor methods within a class to set/read variables.

name: Comment to Code Ratio
description: 'Ratio of number of comment lines to number of code lines. Note that because some lines are both code and comment
categorie: this could easily yield percentages higher than 100'

name: Sum of Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Sum of cyclomatic complexity of all nested functions or methods.
research: Chidamber & Kemerer - Weighted Methods per Class (WCM)

name: Sum of Modified Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Sum of modified cyclomatic complexity of all nested functions or methods.

name: Sum of Strict Cyclomatic Complexity
description: Sum of strict cyclomatic complexity of all nested functions or methods.

name: Sum of Essential Complexity
description: Sum of essential complexity of all nested functions or methods.
